20/21 Will the sum of blockchain technologies turn into a giant Internet, or will their journey unfold as a messy and fragmented evolution?
19/21 We can’t force blockchain standards on the market, but the market needs to embrace standards over time.
18/21 In 2017, we need to see serious discussions on universal standards, and real intentions from industry participants to work together.
17/21 There are promising examples of blockchain related standards & we need to see more of them, e.g. IPFS for files and ERC20 for tokens.
16/21 We need universal tools that no one owns, but that benefit everybody, similar to the Web technologies that liberated the Internet.
15/21 A trust services layer could be that API veneer that homogenizes how we create, move, check, inspect, follow historical paths, etc.
14/21 Blockchain browsers (B-Browsers) are going to be important, and we will start to see them in 2017.
13/21 Blockchains could have a number of standards above the Internet’s existing ones, allowing smooth bridging from one layer to another.
12/21 The Internet and the Web have their standards. Where are the blockchain equivalent?
11/21 Many areas ripe for standards: smart contracts, tokens, security, storage, messaging, identities, naming, record-keeping & more.
10/21 In order to grow-up, blockchains will eventually need a lot of standards that are vendor and solutions agnostic.
9/21 The state of collaboration between blockchains is plagued by timid efforts for building bridges and lateral co-operative capabilities.
8/21 An engineer that knows how to program Bitcoin needs to relearn what they know, in order to develop on other blockchains.
7/21 Unfortunately, blockchains don’t have that luxury yet, as each platform has its own set of technologies and methods to work with.
6/21 Since early days, the Internet and Web have matured nicely, and today rely on close to 200 standards across several layers.
5/21 This scenario is not unlike the position the Internet was in, prior to the Web.
4/21 With so much homogeneity in functionality intent, why so many different and incompatible blockchain technologies and software?
3/21 The variety of available blockchains handle same few basic functions, recording (digital) value without needing a 3rd party to move it.
